security: TLS certificate validation for remote connections

troubleshooting.issue: Permission denied connecting to Docker daemon socket
troubleshooting.solution: Add your user to docker group: sudo usermod -a -G docker $USER, then log out and back in. Alternatively, run sudo systemctl start docker to ensure daemon is running.

troubleshooting.issue: Cannot connect to Docker daemon - connection refused
troubleshooting.solution: Start Docker daemon: sudo systemctl start docker (Linux) or launch Docker Desktop (Mac/Windows). Verify daemon is running: docker ps. Check DOCKER_HOST environment variable points to correct socket.
Run sudo chmod 666 /var/run/docker.sock (temporary fix) or add user to docker group (permanent). Verify socket file exists: ls -l /var/run/docker.sock.
Set DOCKER_API_VERSION environment variable to match your Docker version. Run docker version to check API version. Update MCP server config with correct API version (e.g., 1.43).

troubleshooting.issue: Container operations fail with authentication errors
troubleshooting.solution: Run docker login to authenticate with registry. Verify registry credentials are correct. For private registries, ensure network access and check firewall rules don't block Docker registry ports.
